items.summary: Upgrade the Government Subsidy page (/subsidies) to include (a) a clear Central + State subsidy comparison table for 1kW, 2kW, and 3kW systems, (b) an explanation section for “PM Surya Ghar” and state policy (English page copy; table values may include ₹ amounts), and (c) prominent “Total Subsidy” summary cards showing example totals ₹45,000, ₹90,000, and ₹1,08,000.

Add a Grid-Connected Solar System “Working Diagram” section using a custom infographic that visually shows the flow “Solar Panel → Inverter → Meter → Grid” with Hindi labels inside the diagram, and display three benefit callouts with icons: “60% subsidy”, “25 years power”, and “Big savings on bills” (page copy in English is allowed; Hindi is required inside the diagram labels).

Refactor the Solar Services page (/services) into an “NSPG-style” services grid for GKV Smart Energy with exactly these service categories as cards: Rooftop Residential, Off-Grid, Hybrid, Aata Chakki, Hospital, and College / Hotel / Petrol Pump. Each card must include a short description and a “Learn More” button that routes to a dedicated SEO-friendly detail page for that service.

Implement a functional Solar Savings Calculator on /calculator (replacing the current screenshot-only experience) where the user enters their monthly electricity bill and the UI automatically calculates and displays: recommended system size (kW), estimated annual savings, units generated, space required, and project cost after subtracting subsidy.

Add a prominent “Book Free Consultation” CTA that offers WhatsApp, Call, and Form options, ensuring leads can be initiated directly to the owner’s mobile via WhatsApp deep-link and tel link, and via the existing contact form for form submissions.

Align site navigation labels and information architecture with the recommended structure: Home, About GKV Smart Energy, Government Subsidy, Solar Services, Solar Calculator, Projects / Gallery, Contact Us (while keeping any existing extra pages only if they do not conflict).
